name: Potassium Chloride
indications: potassium chloride extended-release tablets indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .
contraindications: • monitor serum potassium adjust dosages accordingly ( 2.1 ) • serum potassium less 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) • take meals glass water liquid . swallow tablets whole without crushing , chewing sucking . ( 2.1 ) • treatment hypokalemia : doses range 40-100 meq/day divided doses . limit doses 40 meq per dose . ( 2.2 ) • prevention hypokalemia : typical dose 20 meq per day . ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride extended-release tablets , usp available containing 600 mg 750 mg potassium chloride ( equivalent 8 meq 10 meq , respectively ) . 8 meq ( 600 mg ) tablets light brown , film-coated , round , unscored tablets debossed one side tablet pc2 side . available follows : ndc 0378-4560-77bottles 90 tablets ndc 0378-4560-05bottles 500 tablets 10 meq ( 750 mg ) tablets peach , film-coated , round , unscored tablets debossed one side tablet pc1 side . available follows : ndc 0378-4561-77bottles 90 tablets ndc 0378-4561-05bottles 500 tablets store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature . ] protect light moisture . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp using child-resistant closure .
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients triamterene amiloride .
indications_original: Potassium chloride extended-release tablets are indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original: • Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosages accordingly ( 2.1 ) • If serum potassium is less than 2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) • Take with meals and with a glass of water or other liquid. Swallow tablets whole without crushing, chewing or sucking. ( 2.1 ) • Treatment of hypokalemia: Doses range from 40-100 mEq/day in divided doses. Limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. ( 2.2 ) • Prevention of hypokalemia: Typical dose is 20 mEq per day. ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets, USP are available containing 600 mg or 750 mg of potassium chloride (equivalent to 8 mEq or 10 mEq, respectively). 
                  The 8 mEq (600 mg) tablets are light brown, film-coated, round, unscored tablets debossed with M on one side of the tablet and PC2 on the other side. They are available as follows: 
                  NDC 0378-4560-77bottles of 90 tablets
                  NDC 0378-4560-05bottles of 500 tablets
                  The 10 mEq (750 mg) tablets are peach, film-coated, round, unscored tablets debossed with M on one side of the tablet and PC1 on the other side. They are available as follows: 
                  NDC 0378-4561-77bottles of 90 tablets
                  NDC 0378-4561-05bottles of 500 tablets
                  
                     Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.] 
                  
                  
                     Protect from light and moisture.
                  
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP using a child-resistant closure.
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on triamterene and amiloride.
